page.title: 17STORIES FROM NAILSTONE
page.content:
There is a saying about the{old elm {tree}that used to stand by the side of the A447 on the edge of the village. It was said that should this tree perish there would be no more babies born in Nailstone. The story goes that one night Lord Hastings sent some of his workmen to cut the tree down as it had been made unsafe by a storm. The villagers came out to protect the tree fearing the worst. The tree survived and many villagers can remember it as a well known landmark.
A clock maker called{Samuel'Clocky' {Deacon}used to preach to the villagers about the evils of drink. Clocky was locked up in the blacksmith's yard at Smithy Farm for three days and three nights, because of a policeman who had taken some ale whilst he was on duty. This was thought to be Clocky's fault.
